Sir, I dislike you. Your lottery is now somehow permanently in my server…I deleted the Lottery.java file, but it continues to announce in the server messages. >.>
Is there some kind of backup that the compiler made or something?
Where can I fix that? /:
[/quote]
Delete everything else…[/quote]

I did. It was still going after that. It’s okay, though, I trashed that project.

item.title: [PI] Lottery System 100%
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Why make an arraylist of playernames? It would probably more efficient if it was a player object, or E, whatever that is (supposing it’s element).

Your just wasting space here

public ArrayList<String> lotteryPlayersNames = new ArrayList<String> (); //players (playername) public ArrayList<String> unclaimedWinners = new ArrayList<String> (); //Winners that havent claimed public int lotteryFund = 0; public int prizeAmount = 250; //jackpot amount (in millions) public int entryPrice = 2; //price to enter lottery (in millions) public int maximumEntryTimes = 5; //maximum times 1 player can enter per draw public long lastAnnouncment; public int announcmentFrequency = 15; //announcment frequency in mins

Read full topic
